@JenuinePanic @autumnbreezed You may read this novel so I donâ€™t want to give away any spoilers. All Iâ€™ll say is that itâ€™s not a plot device or because Stephenson is trying to empower anyone. It also happens â€œoff-pageâ€. Itâ€™s subtly referenced, not described.

@JenuinePanic @autumnbreezed @keithoconor I was not a fan of RP1. Less about the pastiche to what was also my childhood (Cline is five years older than me) but more about the juvenile themes of â€œgetting the girlâ€ etc.
@autumnbreezed @JenuinePanic @keithoconor I have read both. The tone and delivery couldnâ€™t be more different. Also, any novel whose main character is called Hiro Protagonist is okay in my book ;)
@autumnbreezed @JenuinePanic However, if I remember correctly, there is at least one instance of violence against the protagonist (a woman) in The Diamond Age. That said, itâ€™s handled tactfully.
@autumnbreezed @JenuinePanic Another one of my favourites. Though my wife actually prefers Stephensonâ€™s The Diamond Age to it. Which, admittedly, is more steampunk than cyberpunk.
@JenuinePanic Neuromancer. Also has an amazing female character in Molly Millions.
